|footnotes = 1: During the North German Confederation and German Empire
(1867â1918), the Minister-President of Prussia was also the Chancellor of
Germany. }} The 'Kingdom of Prussia' () was a German kingdom from 1701 to 1918.
From the 1871 unification of Germany to its defeat in World War I, Prussia
comprised almost two-thirds of the territory of the German Empire. It took its
name from the territory of Prussia, although its power base was Brandenburg.

Prussia was a great power since its foundation as a kingdom, though it became a
military power as a duchy under the Great Elector. Fueter, Eduard (1922).
